tasks: Create a wireframe of a simple login form using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design as a reference. Focus on usability and error prevention, highlighting at least 2 heuristics in your design.
Design a visual hierarchy for a hypothetical e-commerce website using Tesler’s Law and Hick’s Law. Explain how these laws influence your design decisions.
Write a short reflection (approx. 250 words) on the Aesthetic-Usability Effect, discussing its implications for UX design.
Conduct a user interview and create a persona based on the results. Use this persona to inform your redesign of a simple UI element (e.g., a button). Focus on usability and accessibility.
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system. Ensure it is visually appealing, easy to navigate, and accessible for users with disabilities.
Create a mind map illustrating the relationships between UX Fundamentals and UI Craft & Visual Design. Explain how each fundamental influences your design decisions in both areas.

Develop a user journey map for an existing product or service, highlighting pain points and opportunities for improvement using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Present your findings to a peer group or mentor.
Create a mood board for a hypothetical UX project, incorporating principles of Aesthetic-Usability Effect and Tesler’s Law. Explain how these principles guide your design decisions.
Write a short essay (approx. 500 words) on the importance of collaboration in UX design, discussing strategies for effective communication with stakeholders and team members.
Design a comprehensive usability test plan for an existing product or service, incorporating principles from Hick’s Law and Tesler’s Law. Present your findings to a peer group or mentor.
Create a UX design system document outlining the principles and guidelines for designing user interfaces. Ensure it is accessible, visually appealing, and easy to use.
Develop a capstone project: Redesign an existing product or service using all the skills and knowledge gained throughout this 4-week improvement plan. Present your findings to a peer group or mentor.

resources.readup: As an Emerging Senior UX designer, you have a solid foundation in UX Fundamentals and User Research & Validation, but there's room for growth in UI Craft & Visual Design and Product Thinking & Strategy. Focus on developing your skills in these areas to take your design career to the next level and deliver exceptional user experiences that drive business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Applying Hick's Law to inform design decisions and optimize user experience.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites and identify areas where Hick's Law is being applied (or not) and provide recommendations for improvement
Design a new interface element that takes into account the limitations of human processing speed, using Hick's Law as a guiding principle
Conduct an A/B test to validate the effectiveness of a design decision based on Hick's Law

topics.name: Crafting Compelling Visual Design with the Laws of UX
topics.summary: Mastering the visual design principles that drive user engagement and conversion.
practice_points: Create 3 wireframes for a new product feature, applying Tesler's Law to inform typography choices
Design a color palette for a brand, using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect as a guide
Build an interactive prototype in Figma that demonstrates the impact of visual hierarchy on user behavior

topics.name: In-depth User Research with the Zeigarnik Effect
topics.summary: Using the Zeigarnik Effect to design research studies that uncover hidden motivations and behaviors.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Zeigarnik Effect framework, focusing on identifying unmet needs and desires
Design a survey or usability study that leverages the Zeigarnik Effect to elicit detailed user feedback
Analyze existing research studies that applied the Zeigarnik Effect and provide recommendations for improvement
